intro: Polyphragmon pseudocapitatum, commonly known as the false sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale blue or white in color. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. It is often found in rocky soils and is a hardy species capable of surviving in extreme drought conditions.
